pkgmetadata.longdescription:
Wirbel is a new programming language. It has a syntax and semantics similar to Python - a very popular language invented by Guido van Rossum. But - unlike Python - Wirbel is a compiler language compiling into native machine code.
This has two great advantages (and several minor ones): * Wirbel programs execute very fast. * Compiled Wirbel programs do not need any runtime environment - not even a library.
These two key features make Wirbel a very interesting language in many situations. The lack of the need for a runtime environment does not only save memory but also makes life easier when distributing your software. And speed almost always matters.
